Consulting vs Coaching

The blurry boundaries

Consulting is conversations. This isn‚Äôt true of course when you‚Äôre more junior - there‚Äôs a lot of ‚Äúdoing‚Äù work. But as you get more senior you realize that meetings, conversations, discussions, workshops and so on become the primary way that work is moved forward.

My entire professional career is in conversation. This is a realization that comes from Niko Canner:

I‚Äôd gone back to consulting because I loved doing my work in conversation: both the real-time exchange of ideas and the way that writing down my thoughts for clients created the opportunity for a slower, more extended form of dialogue. Those were practices to deepen every day.

Executive Co-Pilot
